nouns.description: seder (plural seders or sedarim or sidarim or siddarim)

entries.meaning: (Judaism) The ceremonial meal held on the first night or two nights of Passover.
examples: On the same day, the State of Israel celebrated its first Passover seder and the United Nations, still meeting in those days at Flushing Meadow in Queens, voted to consider the Jewish state's application for membership.

entries.meaning: (Judaism) One of the 54 parts into which the Torah is divided.
